business.headline: These 3 money deadlines you can't miss in March 2025If you want to secure better returns, deposit in these special fixed deposits, which are available only for a limited period. The last date for investing in these schemes is March 31, 2025.

ad:tech New Delhi unveils ad:techHonours to recognise marketing tech innovationHeld on March 6 at Yashobhoomi, in collaboration with the International Advertising Association (IAA) India Chapter, this event brought together industry leaders to honour the innovators shaping the future of tech-driven marketing.

How women investors are winning the race on Dalal StreetWomen are proving to be more disciplined investors, staying invested for longer periods and making better financial decisions. Their patience and careful approach often lead to higher returns compared to men.

Sebi warns Nestle over breach of insider trading regulations: ReportThe Indian arm of Swiss food giant Nestle said its compliance officer received an administrative warning letter from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) on Thursday.

Multiple PANs can attract Rs 10,000 fine. Here's how to avoid  Holding multiple PANs can complicate tax filings and financial transactions as different transactions are recorded under different PANs, resulting in errors, incorrect tax calculations, and possible scrutiny.

Donald Trump's US Strategic Bitcoin Reserve. All you need to know With this executive order, President Trump reinforces his commitment to make the US the 'crypto capital of the world.'

Explained: Why incorporating in India is the best decision for startups in 2025 Kunal Bahl, co-founder and former CEO of Snapdeal, believes that incorporating in India offers multiple advantages, including better funding opportunities, tax benefits, and easier compliance.

Looking for tax benefits under Section 80C? Check these 5 optionsThe contributions made to the Public Provident Fund qualify for tax deductions under Section 80C and the interest earned, along with the maturity amount, is tax-free.

Reliance share price jumps 3% today. Good time to buy stock?Reliance stock price: The company's stock was up 3.41% to Rs 1,251.80 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 11:56 am. However, it is still down over 20% compared to its 52-week high of Rs 1,608.95.

What is EPFO 3.0? 5 key things you can expect While inaugurating EPFO's Telangana zonal office and regional office in Hyderabad, Union Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya mentioned that the upgraded system will bring EPFO's services closer to a banking experience.

Blinkit, Zepto to raise commissions as quick commerce battle intensifies: ReportZepto has been steadily hiking commissions for both users and brands, focusing on unit economics, while Blinkit is rolling out a variable commission model.

Is the bull market dead? Ace investor Shankar Sharma cautions investors for 2025When questioned if small investors can bear losses like experienced traders, Sharma said that all successful investors once started small but grew by overcoming challenges.

Good news from GCCs: Hiring set to outpace IT firms for second year in a rowWith global businesses continuing to expand their operations in India, GCCs (Global capability centres) are expected to play a bigger role in the job market, as per experts.

Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks drag market in early trade; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex fell 206.29 points to 74,133.80, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 63.30 points to 22,481.40 as of 9:17 AM.

Tariff uncertainty clobbers US markets, Nasdaq crashes 10%, S&P slidesStocks fell even though President Trump offered a one-month reprieve from his 25% tariffs on many goods imported from Mexico and Canada. That's unlike the bounce stocks got the prior day from his giving a one-month exemption specifically for automakers.

India to monitor negotiations before taking a call on US tariffs: Finance MinisterFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal is currently in the United States for discussions, and India will wait for the outcome before taking a stance.
L&T introduces one-day paid menstrual leave for women employeesThe announcement was made by Chairman and Managing Director S N Subrahmanyan during an event held to mark International Women's Day.

Bitcoin prices fall 5% after Donald Trump orders US strategic reserveBitcoin prices dropped over 5% a day before Donald Trump is set to meet with top executives from the cryptocurrency industry at the White House.

Gold loans under scanner as RBI plans stricter norms for lenders: ReportThe RBI wants banks and non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) to conduct deeper background checks on borrowers and verify the ownership of the gold being pledged.
DA hike? Will central government employees receive good news before Holi?The government reviews DA twice a year; the January hike is announced around Holi, while July revision is around Diwali.

Britannia Industries CEO Rajneet Singh Kohli resignsKohli submitted his resignation on March 5, 2025, and the Board of Directors has taken note of it through a circular resolution passed on March 6, 2025. He will be relieved from his duties at the close of business hours on March 14, 2025.

You don't need employer's permission for these EPF account changesIf your UAN is already linked to Aadhaar, you can update personal details like name, date of birth, gender, nationality, parents' names, marital status, spouse's name, date of joining, and date of leaving, all without submitting any documents.

Sensex gains 600 points: Why is stock market rising despite early losses?Stock market gains: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 475.17 points to 74,205.40, while the NSE Nifty50 added 171.30 points to 22,508.60 as of 2:20 PM.

Indian jewellers worry as Trump's reciprocal tariffs spark job loss fears: ReportKey Indian exports to the US include cut and polished diamonds, studded gold jewellery, plain gold jewellery, lab-grown diamonds, and silver jewellery.

Sensex, Nifty rally for 2nd straight day: Is D-Street ready for a bull run?The two-day recovery rally on Dalal Street, though encouraging, comes amid global uncertainty, particularly concerns over a possible trade war. While some experts remain cautious about calling this a full-fledged market recovery, they acknowledge that conditions are improving for a potential uptrend.

How much will Donald Trump's reciprocal tariffs cost India?During a joint session of the US Congress, President Donald Trump said that other countries have charged the US high tariffs for years, and it was time to respond.

Delhi Mahila Samriddhi Scheme: Check if you are eligible for Rs 2,500 monthly aidThe Delhi government will launch an online portal where women can submit their applications. The IT department is also developing special software to verify eligibility.

US may push India for zero tariffs on nearly all goods: Report The development comes as US President Donald Trump keeps criticising India over what he calls 'unfair' trade practices. He recently announced that reciprocal tariffs would kick in on April 2 and made it clear that India wouldn't be getting any special treatment.

Jindal Group's Sajjan Jindal says Elon Musk's Tesla won't succeed IndiaSajjan Jindal doubts Elon Musk's Tesla can thrive in India, but with office space secured and hiring underway, Musk seems determined to challenge local giants like Tata and Mahindra.

Nithin Kamath doesn't want you to stop SIPs amid market correction. Here's whyZerodha Founder and CEO Nithin Kamath believes this is not the right time to stop systematic investment plans (SIPs) despite the market correction on Dalal Street.

entertainment.headline: Mobland trailer: Tom Hardy, Pierce Brosnan headline Guy Ritchie's new crime showMobland, the much-awaited crime series by Guy Ritchie, is all set for its grand premiere on JioHotstar this March. Featuring stars like Tom Hardy and Helen Mirren, the show explores the dark world of international crime syndicates.

Rishab Sharma on popularising Sitar, starting his own clothing brandRenowned 26-year-old sitar player Rishab Rikhiram Sharma blends classical and modern music. Trained under Ravi Shankar, he performs globally, including at the White House. Known for his mehendi-adorned hands, he also creates music for mental health.

What Rick Hoffman's entry as Louis Litt means for Suits LAActor Rick Hoffman will be reprising his iconic character, Louis Litt, from 'Suits', in one of the upcoming episodes of 'Suits LA'. The news comes days after the show received bad reviews for lacking excitement like the original one.

Why sitarist Rishab Sharma wears mehndi for every performanceSitarist Rishab Sharma embraces mehndi as part of his stage presence, blending tradition with innovation. The young sitarist shares how he enhances performance aesthetics while breaking stereotypes.

Sitarist Rishab Sharma: Said no to performing at White House initiallyRenowned sitarist and internet sensation Rishab Sharma opened up about performing at the White House, choosing the sitar over guitar, and more, during his appearance at India Today Conclave 2025 in New Delhi on Friday.

Shabana Azmi says Shibani Akhtar 'pulled her by the ear' to join Dabba CartelShabana Azmi revealed at the India Today Conclave 2025 that Shibani Akhtar "pulled her by the ear" to make her join Dabba Cartel. Shibani always envisioned her as part of the series.

Shabana Azmi on Dabba Cartel, rise of OTT, and feminism in cinema. VideoAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Shabana Azmi spoke about her role in Dabba Cartel, emphasising that 'power can be quiet'. Co-creator Shibani Akhtar revealed that the concept was built around the idea of a "Shabana Azmi drug cartel" from the outset. The series presents a compelling narrative of women coming together in solidarity within a crime drama, with Azmi's nuanced and quiet yet powerful performance serving as its anchor. Her portrayal marks a significant thematic shift in Indian storytelling. Jyotika also shared her experience and connection to her character, highlighting how the roles reflect real-life struggles faced by women, as well as themes of feminism and women's emancipation.

Jyotika on working with Shabana Azmi in Dabba Cartel: She was a friend to usActor Jyotika was recently seen in the newly-released show Dabba Cartel. At India Today Conclave 2025, she spoke about her character in the crime drama, her camaraderie with Shabana Azmi and what drew her to Dabba Cartel.

Shabana Azmi, Jyotika and Shibani Dandekar open up about making Dabba Cartel. PicsDabba Cartel actors Shabana Azmi, Jyotika and creator Shibani Dandekar graced the India Today Conclave 2025 on Friday, where they shared their experience of creating the Netflix series.

BTS J-hope's Sweet Dreams is a sensuous song brought alive by Miguel's vocalsBTS member J-hope has released a new song called Sweet Dreams, which also features the American artiste Miguel. Check out the music video inside.

Dupahiya review: A wholesome watch for your next relaxed weekendReleased-Fri Mar 07, 2025Dupahiya review: This Prime Video series is a charming small-town comedy with endearing performances, witty dialogues, and social themes. While it drags at times, its humour and heart make it a delightful, easy watch.

Unpopular opinion: Korean star Lee Min-ho is overratedSouth Korean star Lee Min-ho is a beloved actor. But he is certainly not the most talented or versatile artiste out there. Min-ho is currently seen in the show, When the Stars Gossip, which is streaming on Netflix.

general news.headline: Trump sending 'don't come' message: Mike Pompeo on shackled Indian immigrantsSpeaking at the India Today Conclave session, Mike Pompeo defended the handcuffs and shackles used on the immigrants and said that the deportees who were sent back to their countries in the first round were "violent, convicted criminals".

Considering tariffs on Russia until peace deal with Ukraine reached: TrumpTrump's statement came days after reports claimed that the US was considering a plan to potentially give Russia sanctions relief as Trump was seeking to restore ties with Moscow and stop the war in Ukraine.

Doesn't create love: Top US official on idea of Brics currency replacing dollarUS Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick said that India's purchase of weapons from Russia and its participation in the Brics alliance, which seeks to "replace" the American dollar, are obstacles to the existing India-US relations.

Revanth Reddy's big delimitation charge: BJP seeking revenge against SouthTelangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy said that through the proposed delimitation exercise, the BJP wanted to reduce the representation of the South in Parliament.

Aamir Khan recalls 'tough' Andaz Apna Apna shoot, fight between actorsSuperstar Aamir Khan graced the India Today Conclave session on Friday, wherein he discussed the making of his cult classic, Andaz Apna Apna.

Rs 55 lakh, 8 months, and nothing: The story of illegal immigrant Satpal SinghSatpal Singh, an Indian illegal immigrant, was deported from the US on February 28. He recounted his harrowing experience at the India Today Conclave 2025. From spending Rs 55 lakh and eight months, some of it in detention in tortuous conditions, Singh's story is a tale of warning to others.

Karnataka's Halal Budget: BJP's swipe at Congress over funds for MuslimsThe BJP strongly criticised the Karnataka budget for 2025-26, accusing the Congress of appeasing Muslims with Rs 1,000 crore for minorities, Waqf protection, Urdu schools, and 4 per cent contract reservations under Category-II B.

Let's bring India tariffs policy down and get America in: US Commerce SecretaryThe United States is keen on establishing a comprehensive, large-scale trade agreement with India that encompasses all key aspects, US Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick said as he addressed the India Today Conclave on Friday.

How did Rajkumar Hirani convince Aamir Khan to do 3 IdiotsAamir Khan recently shared how he was against playing a college student in his 40s in Rajkumar Hirani's 3 Idiots.  At India Today Conclave 2025, the actor revealed how the director convinced him for his role in the movie.

Trump-Zelenskyy clash very unfortunate, but won't alter US stance: Mike PompeoFormer US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo called the public confrontation between Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy at the White House 'unfortunate' but asserted that it would not change the US's approach to the conflict.

Man, his two girlfriends poison another woman for refusing to end relationshipA 35-year-old woman was allegedly poisoned and thrown into a gorge by her boyfriend and his two girlfriends in Tamil Nadu. Police arrested the trio after uncovering the murder, which was staged as a suicide.

In Cabinet meeting, Trump draws the Lakshman Rekha for MuskIn a Cabinet meeting on March 6, US President Donald Trump drew the line for Elon Musk and his DOGE. He made it clear that Musk and DOGE had just an advisory role and didn't have the final say in hirings and firings. Trump's hard talk came after concerns over voter backlash to mass firings in the federal government.

Harbhajan defends Mohammed Shami on fasting row: Keep sports and religion apartChampions Trophy: Harbhajan Singh defended Mohammed Shami against criticism for not fasting during India's Champions Trophy semi-final, stating that athletes need to stay hydrated to perform in extreme conditions. He dismissed concerns that the controversy would affect Shami during the final against New Zealand on Sunday in Dubai.

MK Stalin's unity call to 7 states amid delimitation row, calls big Chennai meetTamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin wrote a letter to various chief ministers, including all south Indian states, along with his counterparts from West Bengal, Odisha and Punjab. He called to form a Joint Action Committee to plan for the upcoming delimitation exercise.
Trump writes to Iran to negotiate nuclear deal, hopes for talksUS President Donald Trump said he had written to Iran's leadership to negotiate a nuclear deal with the country.

Learnt Hindi so I could take on Modi ji: Revanth Reddy quips amid language rowTelangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy slams BJP for pushing Hindi, says he learned the language to counter Modi politically and questions why Telugu and other regional languages are being sidelined.

When fire and poison stalled Hindi's march to Tamil NaduIn 1965, when Hindi was to become India's official language, Tamil Nadu (then Madras State) saw fiery protests that are said to have claimed 150 lives. Many Tamils set themselves on fire and consumed pesticides, thus forcing then-PM Lal Bahadur Shastri to roll back the language decision 60 years ago.

India's tough talk on UK-based extremists after Jaishankar security breachThe government said that its assessment of the UK's statement on the security breach during External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's London visit depends on the action taken against those responsible.
Air Force aircraft crashes during training sortie in Haryana, pilot ejects safelyThe aircraft had taken off from the Ambala airbase on a training sortie and it crashed in Panchkula.

Medicine, not miracle drug: Top pharma executive busts weight-loss myths At India Today Conclave 2025, Vikrant Shrotriya, Managing Director of Novo Nordisk India, said that a weight-loss drug is not a magic pill. Instead, it is a medicine that works alongside diet and exercise.
Chandrayaan-3 reveals big secret about the Moon The presence of accessible ice could serve as a vital resource for long-term exploration and potential settlement.

China stands guard amid Trump's tariff squeezeChinese observers believe the tariff will cause short-term pain, but the impact will be generally manageable. With re-exports via ASEAN and other countries, the overall impact on China's exports may be smaller than expected.

Not the Chief Minister who sits in sheeshmahal: Rekha Gupta jabs Arvind KejriwalIn a dig at AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal, Rekha Gupta said that she is not the kind of Chief Minister who sits and works in 'sheeshmahal'. She made the remark while speaking at the India Today Conclave being held at Delhi's Taj Palace.

Telangana model is Twenty20, Gujarat's is Test and dated: Revanth ReddyTelangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy at the India Today Conclave 2025 threw down an open challenge by comparing Gujarat model of development with that of a test match.

How did Rajkumar Hirani convince Aamir Khan to do 3 IdiotsAamir Khan recently shared how he was against playing a college student in his 40s in Rajkumar Hirani's 3 Idiots.  At India Today Conclave 2025, the actor revealed how the director convinced him for his role in the movie.

3 Idiots: Aamir Khan didn't want to do it. How did Rajkumar Hirani convince him?Actor Aamir Khan attended the India Today Conclave 2025 on March 7 in Delhi. While speaking about 3 Idiots, the actor revealed that he wasn't convinced to play a college-going student in the film. He said, "I was completely against doing it. Raju (Rajkumar Hirani) kept insisting, but I told him, 'The story is great, but why do you want me in it? I'm over 40! Cast an 18-year-old instead.' " He was scared to play Rancho but Hirani's conviction made him say yes to the film.

Aamir Khan reflects on 3 decades in BollywoodAamir Khan, who will turn 60 on March 14, attended India Today Conclave in Delhi on March 7. He discussed turning 60, a career spanning three decades, and his approach to filmmaking. The Bollywood superstar reflected on his iconic films like Qayamat Se Qayamat Tak, Lagaan, Andaz Apna Apna and 3 Idiots. Khan shared insights on his creative process, taking risks, and balancing fear with conviction.

Aamir Khan recalls 'tough' Andaz Apna Apna shoot, fight between actorsSuperstar Aamir Khan graced the India Today Conclave session on Friday, wherein he discussed the making of his cult classic, Andaz Apna Apna.

Rajeev Shukla replaces Jay Shah as Executive Board Member in Asian Cricket CouncilBCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla will join the Asian Cricket Council (ACC) Board as an Executive Board Member. The position became vacant after Jay Shah stepped down as ACC president in December 2024.

Waqar Younis hits back at Hafeez's 'no legacy from 90s cricketers' commentPakistan fast bowler Waqar Younis has hit back at Mohammad Hafeez for claiming that the 90s cricketers left no legacy for Pakistan's future generations due to their inability to win multiple ICC titles.

New Zealand will look to use their experience of having played a group game in Dubai when they meet India on what is expected to be another sluggish pitch.

Shubman Gill vs Steve Smith in battle for ICC Player of the MonthShubman Gill's red-hot form has earned him an ICC Player of the Month nomination for February, competing against Australia's Steve Smith and New Zealand's Glenn Phillips after a stellar run in ODIs and the Champions Trophy.

WTA announces paid maternity leave for women's tennis players The WTA announced on Thursday that, for the first time, it will provide players with up to 12 months of paid maternity leave. This is part of a comprehensive new family benefits initiative backed by the Saudi Public Investment Fund.

Emma Raducanu crashes out on emotional return after stalking incidentIndian Wells 2025: Emma Raducanu couldn't go through to the second round of the tournament after Moyuka Uchijima of Japan defeated her 6-3, 6-2 on Thursday, March 6.

Inspired by Virat Kohli's work ethics, India's Sayali aims to soar high In an exclusive chat with India Today Digital, Indian all-rounder Sayali Satghare spoke about her recent debut for the national team in the series against Ireland and also shared her experience of playing for the Gujarat Giants in the WPL.

What happened in India and New Zealand's only meeting in the final? Champions Trophy: In their only meeting in the final of the tournament back in 2000, Chris Cairns' 102 not out overshadowed Sourav Ganguly's 117 as New Zealand beat India by four wickets in Nairobi.

Bear with the bullies: Is criticism of India fair or case of sour grapes?India's dominance in cricket sparks controversy as critics question the fairness of the side playing all their Champions Trophy fixtures in Dubai and not the original venue in Pakistan. India face off against New Zealand in the Champions Trophy final on March 9.

Amorim promises 'different' Manchester United after Sociedad drawRuben Amorim assured Manchester United fans of a stronger, more focused performance at Old Trafford in their Europa League second leg against Real Sociedad, promising tactical improvements after their first-leg struggles in the 1-1 draw.

Suryakumar defends Rohit amid 'captaincy' row: Led us to 4 ICC FinalsSuryakumar Yadav defended Rohit Sharma against criticism, highlighting his leadership in guiding India to four ICC finals. He reminded of Rohit leading India to the 2024 T20 World Cup triumph, as the team gears up for the Champions Trophy final against New Zealand.

England Cricket Board issues apology for 'ill-judged' Pope Francis jokeThe England and Wales Cricket Board faced backlash after joking about Pope Francis "loving the Ashes" in response to his Ash Wednesday message. The post was deleted, and ECB issued an apology for the insensitivity.

IND vs NZ: Virat Kohli's calmness gives Gautam Gambhir's India its ODI identityIn an era when every team needs to have an 'identity', India's ODI team under Gautam Gambhir is deriving its spirit from the calmness of Virat Kohli. The star batter has been in sensational form for India in the Champions Trophy.

UP Warriorz all but knocked out as Matthews, Kerr power MI to 6-wicket winHayley Matthews smashed a 46-ball 68, while Amelia Kerr registered her best figures of 5/38 as Mumbai Indians stormed to a six-wicket win over UP Warriorz in the Women's Premier League.

Mitchell Santner banking on form ahead of final, says extra travel part of jobNew Zealand skipper Mitchell Santner said that he was banking on his team's form ahead of the Champions Trophy final against India. New Zealand beat South Africa in a high-scoring contest to reach the summit clash.

Champions Trophy 2025 Final: ICC announces umpiring line-upPaul Reiffel and Richard Illingworth, two of the most respected names amongst the umpires are set to officiate the Champions Trophy Final between India and New Zealand on Sunday, March 9.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
